et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin {it}rata{/it}, from Latin ({it}pro{/it}) {it}rata{/it} ({it}parte{/it}) according to a fixed proportion
shortdef: a quantity, amount, or degree of something measured per unit of something else

dt: {bc}to determine or assign the relative rank or class of {bc}{sx|grade||}
{bc}to estimate the normal capacity or power of
{bc}to fix the amount of premium to be charged per unit of insurance on
{bc}to enjoy a status of special privilege

pt: {sc}estimate{/sc} {sc}appraise{/sc} {sc}evaluate{/sc} {sc}value{/sc} {sc}rate{/sc} {sc}assess{/sc} mean to judge something with respect to its worth or significance. {sc}estimate{/sc} implies a judgment, considered or casual, that precedes or takes the place of actual measuring or counting or testing out.
{sc}appraise{/sc} commonly implies the fixing by an expert of the monetary worth of a thing, but it may be used of any critical judgment.
{sc}evaluate{/sc} suggests an attempt to determine relative or intrinsic worth in terms other than monetary.
{sc}value{/sc} equals {sc}appraise{/sc} but without implying expertness of judgment.

pt.t: a watercolor {it}valued{/it} by the donor at $500

pt: {sc}rate{/sc} adds to {sc}estimate{/sc} the notion of placing a thing according to a scale of values.
{sc}assess{/sc} implies a critical appraisal for the purpose of understanding or interpreting, or as a guide in taking action.

pt.t: officials are trying to {it}assess{/it} the damage

shortdef: to set an estimate on : value, esteem
to determine or assign the relative rank or class of : grade
to estimate the normal capacity or power of

dt: {bc}the rate at which heat is given off by an organism at complete rest

shortdef: the rate at which heat is given off by an organism at complete rest

dt: {bc}a measure of the speed of data processing usually calculated as the number of {d_link|bits|bit:4} per second

dt.t: MP3 measures compression settings in terms of a file's {wi}bit rate{/wi}—the average number of bits required for one second of sound.

shortdef: a measure of the speed of data processing usually calculated as the number of bits per second

dt: {bc}a rate for large shipments lower than that quoted for less-than-carload lots of the same class

shortdef: a rate for large shipments lower than that quoted for less-than-carload lots of the same class

dt: {bc}the ratio between deaths and confirmed or reported cases of a specific disease or medical condition within a given time period

dt.t: Among the immunocompetent patients who had invasive pneumococcal infections caused by serotypes represented in the vaccine, the {wi}case fatality rate{/wi} was 33 percent (23 of 70) among those who had been vaccinated and 25 percent (186 of 738) among those who had not.
If untreated, the {wi}case-fatality rate{/wi} of inhaled anthrax exceeds 80%.

aq.source: {it}The Journal of the American Medical Association{/it}

shortdef: the ratio between deaths and confirmed or reported cases of a specific disease or medical condition within a given time period —abbreviation CFR

dt: {bc}the ratio between deaths and individuals in a specified population during a particular time period {bc}the incidence of deaths in a given population during a defined time period (such as one year) that is typically expressed per 1000 or 100,000 individuals {bc}{sx|mortality rate||}

dt.t: an annual {wi}death rate{/wi} of 15 deaths per 1000 people

dt: A crude death rate does not distinguish between specific causes of death or groups of individuals and measures the incidence of all deaths in a population during a given time period. More specific death rates are based on narrower categories of individuals or causes of death.

dt.t: an infant {wi}death rate{/wi} of 9 deaths per 1000 live births
Ebola is infamous for being highly contagious and causing {wi}death rates{/wi} as high as 90 percent in some human outbreaks.

shortdef: the ratio between deaths and individuals in a specified population during a particular time period : the incidence of deaths in a given population during a defined time period (such as one year) that is typically expressed per 1000 or 100,000 individuals : mortality rate

{bc}the charge levied by a central bank for advances and rediscounts

shortdef: the interest on an annual basis deducted in advance on a loan
the charge levied by a central bank for advances and rediscounts

dt: {bc}the ratio at which the principal unit of two currencies may be traded

shortdef: the ratio at which the principal unit of two currencies may be traded
